page.title: 14High Barns Piggery.
page.content: We visited the Piggery at High Barns. We saw the pregnant sows which were kept in separate stalls. They had measured food and an open and covered area. Then we saw the delivery stalls. There was afterbirth still there and lots of piglets only hours old. Piglets stayed with the sows for 14 days. There were straw yards where 'gilts' were penned.These were sold to other farmers to be fattened for slaughter. The pigs were confined in small spaces. Old sows were slaughtered for sausages. Although the pigs seemed quite happy many pupils decided to become vegetarians.
